answers.answer: I thought diabetes causes a sweet odor.  Green tea does smell kind of sour, like old straw that has gotten wet, but he is right, it is actually good for him, it's too bad you dislike the smell so much.  Does him brushing his teeth not change anything?  Or using a mouthwash?  Perhaps you should also drink the green tea (it's pretty good with sugar) and it will numb your sense of him being stinky from it.  (Like when two people eat a garlic-laden dish, they can't smell the garlic on each other.)  Do you have this problem when he eats other stinky stuff, like onions or garlic?  If so, maybe you just generally don't like food smells on him and you guys might need to find ways to accommodate this overall.

question: My husband enjoys drinking green tea but when he does, I smell a sort of foul odor coming from his mouth and it carries on until the morning.  The whole room smells like this and I have a hard time speaking with him or even wanting to be close to him.  No one else seems to smell it but me.  I have a very strong sense of smell.  I had asked him to stop drinking the tea but he insists it is good for him.  Can this smell be a sign of something else being wrong?  I had heard the diabetes can cause this.  Thanks.
title: Four Odor after drinking tea
